document.docAuthor: Rodrigues, Bruno V. B. & Rheims, Cristina A.
document.masterDocTitle: An overview of the African genera of Prodidominae spiders: descriptions and remarks (Araneae: Gnaphosidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An overview of the African genera of Prodidominae spiders: descriptions and remarks (Araneae: Gnaphosidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Purcelliana Cooke, 1964: 282
( Type species by monotypy,
Purcelliana problematica Cooke, 1964
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Species of
Purcelliana
are distinguished from those of other Prodidominae genera by the presence of short clavate setae on the carapace, chelicerae, legs and abdomen ( Figs 26A , C–E) and by having legs I markedly longer than the other legs ( Fig. 26B ). Males are distinguished by the short embolus arising from the tegulum at 10 o’clock position ( Figs 30 A–D, 31B, E, 32B), and females by the epigyne with a pair of V-shaped copulatory openings and a triangular posterior median depression ( Figs 32E , 33D ).
Distribution. Namibia and South Africa ( Fig. 34 ).

Composition. Four species:
Purcelliana cederbergensis
sp. nov.
,
P. kamaseb
sp. nov.
,
P. khabus
sp. nov.
and
P. problematica Cooke, 1964
.
